author: diego.rey@pulzo.com
title: Juegos OlÃ­mpicos; Colombia Femenina pierde contra Francia en ParÃ­s; posiciones
text: [RedacciÃ³n Deportes](/deportes) La SelecciÃ³n Colombia arribÃ³ a Lyon, Francia, para enfrentar a las locales en su debut por los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos de ParÃ­s 2024. El encuentro fue difÃ­cil para las â€˜cafeterasâ€™ en el primer tiempo, pues en tan solo 20 minutos sufrieron la arremetida de las europeas que marcaron de la mano de Dali y Katoto. (Vea tambiÃ©n: [CuÃ¡ndo vuelve a jugar la SelecciÃ³n Colombia Femenina; le toca contra campeona de JJ. OO.](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/cuando-vuelve-jugar-seleccion-colombia-femenina-juegos-olimpicas-rival-PP3820433)) En el minuto 42â€™, Katoto volviÃ³ a pintarse de heroÃ­na y marcÃ³ el tercero para sentenciar lo que serÃ­a una goleada desproporcionada ante las colombianas. El tÃ©cnico Ãngelo Marsiglia decidiÃ³ mover su banco y sacÃ³ a Daniela Montoya para darle paso a Manuela Pavi, que fue fundamental para la â€˜Tricolorâ€™. La disputa en el estadio Parc Olympique Lyonnais tomÃ³ color al minuto 54â€™, cuando derribaron a Mayra RamÃ­rez y la jueza seÃ±alÃ³ el punto penal, decretando asÃ­ una oportunidad para el combinado colombiano. El balÃ³n lo tomÃ³ Catalina Usme, quien desde los 12 pasos la mandÃ³ al fondo y puso el descuento para Colombia. El equipo se motivÃ³ y mÃ¡s tarde, Manuela Pavi aumentÃ³ el marcador al minuto 64â€™. Y aunque Colombia siguiÃ³ buscando el empate, sintiÃ³ un balde de agua frÃ­a con la expulsiÃ³n de RamÃ­rez al minuto 86â€™. Las â€˜cafeterasâ€™ no levantaron cabeza y cayeron ante las locales en un partido que complica sus aspiraciones de clasificar a la siguiente ronda. [Â¿QuÃ© dÃ­as competirÃ¡n los deportistas colombianos en Juegos OlÃ­mpicos? Revelan calendario](/deportes/asi-es-calendario-juegos-olimpicos-para-deportistas-atletas-colombianos-PP3815162) [CÃ³mo serÃ¡ la inauguraciÃ³n de los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos; se habla de 2 grandes artistas](/deportes/como-sera-inauguracion-juegos-olimpicos-paris-2024-PP3819051A) [CuÃ¡ndo vuelve a jugar la SelecciÃ³n Colombia Femenina en los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos; debe ganar](/deportes/cuando-vuelve-jugar-seleccion-colombia-femenina-juegos-olimpicas-rival-PP3820433) [ðŸ”´ SelecciÃ³n Colombia vs. Francia EN VIVO: amargo debut de la 'Tricolor' en ParÃ­s 2024](/deportes/seleccion-colombia-femenina-vs-francia-vivo-juegos-olimpicos-2024-PP3819473) Tabla de posiciones Colombia femenina (Juegos OlÃ­mpicos) - Francia â€“ 3 puntos - CanadÃ¡ â€“ 3 puntos - Colombia â€“ 0 puntos - Nueva Zelanda â€“ 0 puntos LO ÃšLTIMO [Deportes] Hace 2 horas ["Una decepciÃ³n": taxistas en Paris, enojados por cierres viales y plata que han perdido](/deportes/juegos-olimpicos-taxistas-paris-enojados-por-cierres-viales-alla-PP3838469) [Deportes] Hace 3 horas [Carlos RamÃ­rez saliÃ³ en ambulancia de los JJ. OO. y con video mostrÃ³ fractura que sufriÃ³](/deportes/carlos-ramirez-quebro-mano-jj-oo-caida-carrera-bmx-PP3838403) [Deportes]

author: globalist
title: Paragone si dimette da Italexit: â€œTorno a fare il giornalista, via il mio nome dal partito e dai sondaggiâ€
text:
Gianluigi Paragone si Ã¨ dimesso da segretario di Italexit con effetto immediato e con dimissioni irrevocabili. Questa la lettera aperta con cui ha motivato la sua decisione. Â«Carissimi elettori, tesserati e simpatizzanti di Italexit Per lâ€™Italia, la mia segreteria termina qui. Ho rassegnato le mie dimissioni irrevocabiliÂ».
Â«Paragone ha anche specificato che il partito non potrÃ  piÃ¹ avvalersi del suo nome e cognome per le proprie attivitÃ  e nelle rilevazioni sondaggisticheÂ».
Â«Non câ€™Ã¨ una sola ragione che puÃ² motivare una scelta cosÃ¬ radicale, ci si arriva perchÃ© il tempo fa maturare alcune idee e alcuni pensieri. Intanto avevo sempre detto che non sarei rimasto segretario a lungo: Ã¨ giusto che altre persone si carichino lâ€™impegno di elaborare, con rinnovato entusiasmo, tesi politiche. Penso che sia arrivato questo tempo: energie nuove per sfide da rilanciare a tempo pienoÂ».
Â«Lâ€™essersi posizionati con fermezza su quel fronte consente allâ€™attuale maggioranza (specie a Fratelli dâ€™Italia e Lega) di godere di un bonus di fiducia e soprattutto di una posizione politica di negoziazione che renderÃ  la vita difficile a chi si Ã¨ arreso da tempo alle logiche di BruxellesÂ».
Â«Io la penso cosÃ¬ e siccome non Ã¨ mia intenzione convincere tutti della mia lettura dei fatti Ã¨ giusto che io non impegni il partito e rassegni le dimissioni. ContinuerÃ² a elaborare il mio pensiero nelle vesti che mi sono piÃ¹ proprie, ossia quelle giornalistiche e di saggista. Avendo accresciuto il mio impegno professionale (comâ€™era normale che fosse non volendo campare di politica), non intendo generare confusione nellâ€™elettore, nel telespettatore e nel lettore laddove guardandomi o leggendomi possa pensare: parla il politico o il giornalista?Â».
Â«Ecco, anche nel massimo rispetto altrui, Ã¨ giusto che io sciolga totalmente il mio rapporto con il partito. Che da questo momento in avanti non potrÃ  piÃ¹ avvalersi del mio nome e del mio cognome per le proprie attivitÃ : questione di correttezza. Pertanto ho dato mandato affinchÃ© sul sito scompaiano i miei riferimenti personali cosÃ¬ da non generare confusione; chiederÃ² inoltre alle societÃ  di sondaggio di eliminare il mio cognome dal nome del partito. Sono stati anni di intense battaglie, che rifarei tutte, per questo le tengo nella mia memoria e nel mio cuore. Grazie a tutti coloro che ci hanno dato fiducia e sostegno. A tutti auguro buona stradaÂ».

author: @InsideWorldFoo1
title: Pochettino's American Nightmare: When $6 million buys you four straight defeats - Inside World Football
text:
June 12 â€“ The 4-0 thrashing by Switzerland has exposed the harsh reality of Mauricio Pochettinoâ€™s US Menâ€™s National Team project: expensive doesnâ€™t always mean effective.
After four consecutive defeats, the numbers tell a damning story. The United States hasnâ€™t been this hapless since November 1980, when Mexico delivered a similar 4-0 humiliation. More troubling, the Americans havenâ€™t beaten European opposition in eight attempts dating back to 2021 â€“ a streak that undermines any claims about closing the gap with footballâ€™s elite.
The inability to compete with European sides isnâ€™t just a statistical anomaly â€“ itâ€™s a recurring pattern that questions the entire development pathway. If the players canâ€™t handle Switzerlandâ€™s intensity, what hope exists against Germany, France, or Spain at the World Cup?
Pochettinoâ€™s post-match explanation rang hollow: â€œIt was my decision and the decision didnâ€™t work. Itâ€™s painful because you donâ€™t want to improve losing games.â€
Nine changes from the team that lost 2-1 against Turkey on June 7 might explain tactical confusion, but it doesnâ€™t excuse the complete capitulation before half time.
The â€œexperimental squadâ€ narrative only works if the experiments occasionally succeed. When established players consistently find reasons to withdraw from international duty, it suggests deeper problems than mere squad rotation.
Walker Zimmermanâ€™s attempt at damage control revealed the mentality plaguing American football: â€œItâ€™s really easy to look at one game, one half and be like, oh, this is all going to pieces; they canâ€™t come back from this.â€
These defeats arrive at the worst possible moment â€“ months before hosting the World Cup and days before the Concacaf Gold Cup begins.
Tim Reamâ€™s assessment proved more honest: â€œThereâ€™s some individual errors that we make, and we get punished for them at this level.â€
The timing couldnâ€™t be worse. As World Cup hosts, American expectations have reached unprecedented levels. The $6 million annual investment in Pochettino was supposed to deliver immediate improvements, not historical embarrassments.
The Gold Cup opener against Trinidad & Tobago looms as a potential fifth consecutive defeat. For a national federation that positioned itself as a rising power, such regression would be catastrophic for U.S. Soccer.
A final appearance at the Gold Cup has become the minimum acceptable outcome â€“ anything less and the federation faces questions about competence that extend far beyond the coach.
The clock is ticking, and American footballâ€™s credibility hangs in the balance.
Contact the writer of this story, Nick Webster, at nick.webster@insideworldfootball.com

author: JosÃ© Manuel GutiÃ©rrez
title: Selwo Marina abre sus puertas para la conservaciÃ³n de las Tortugas Boba - La OpiniÃ³n de MÃ¡laga
text: Selwo Marina se suma a la colaboraciÃ³n de Head-Starting para la supervivencia de las Tortugas Boba, especie de tortuga marina que en este momento se encuentra en un estado de conservaciÃ³n Vulnerable, segÃºn el CatÃ¡logo Andaluz de Especies Amenazadas de 2012. El zoo localizado en la localidad de BenalmÃ¡dena ha recibido este lunes 1 de julio un total de 5 ejemplares de esta especie de tortugas y que hasta la fecha se encontraban en el Centro de GestiÃ³n del Medio Marino del Estrecho (Cegma). Alberto MartÃ­n, director de Selwo Costa del Sol, ha corroborado que para la organizaciÃ³n es importante participar en estas acciones, ya que ''es lo que da mÃ¡s sentido aÃºn a la labor de conservaciÃ³n, de divulgaciÃ³n sobre el respeto al medio ambiente y a la labor cientÃ­fica y educativa''. Esta acciÃ³n se desarrolla gracias al Programa Head Starting de la ConserjerÃ­a de Sostenibilidad, Medio Ambiente y EconomÃ­a Azul, dependiente de la Junta de AndalucÃ­a. La intenciÃ³n es que las 5 tortugas que llegaron al Selwo Marina permanezcan en las instalaciones hasta que el agua adquiera una mayor temperatura. Cuando esto ocurra las cinco especies de tortuga boba serÃ¡n devueltas al mar. Este es un programa donde la cooperaciÃ³n entre zoos, acuarios y oceanogrÃ¡ficos e instituciones, junto con el voluntariado y colaboraciÃ³n ciudadana, es fundamental para que estas crÃ­as salgan adelante. Las acciones que realizan estos equipos son tan esenciales que permiten la crÃ­a en cautividad temporal de una parte de las tortugas reciÃ©n nacidas en un contexto donde se estima que tan solo 1 de cada 1.000 tortugas sobrevive al primer aÃ±o natural de vida. Estas crÃ­as de tortugas boba pasan de nacedoras con el suelo de arena del mar a tanques acondicionados como los instalados en Selwo Marina, para que se puedan fortalecer y empezar su vida en el ecosistema marino al que pertenecen. Muestra del compromiso que tienen en Selwo Marina es la ilusiÃ³n en el parque es mÃ¡xima y donde el responsable destaca que ''es un proyecto precioso, nos enorgullece tomar parte, somos una colecciÃ³n zoolÃ³gica esencialmente marina y poder colaborar en la conservaciÃ³n de estas tortugas es muy importante para nosotrosâ€.

author: @NCRegister
title: 2023 Witnessed Continued Attacks on Pro-Life Pregnancy Centers, Churches|
text: 2023 Witnessed Continued Attacks on Pro-Life Pregnancy Centers, Churches Attacks continued throughout 2023, with the latest reported act of vandalism occurring this fall at a group of Catholic churches. Pro-life institutions continued to be targets of pro-abortion attacks in 2023 following the landmark Supreme Court decision in June 2022 overturning Roe v. Wade. Roe, the 1973 case that legalized abortion nationwide, was struck down on June 24 â€” the solemnity of the Most Sacred Heart of Jesus â€” with the decision on the Mississippi abortion case Dobbs v. Jackson Womenâ€™s Health Organization. â€œThe Constitution does not prohibit the citizens of each state from regulating or prohibiting abortion. Roe and Casey arrogated that authority. We now overrule those decisions and return that authority to the people and their elected representatives,â€ the majority opinion in the case said. Before Roeâ€™s downfall, news of the imminent Dobbs opinion was [leaked to the media](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251115/supreme-court-will-overturn-roe-v-wade-according-to-draft-opinion). Enraged pro-abortion activists began [targeting Catholic churches](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251169/ruth-sent-us-abortion-group-threat-catholic-masses) as opportunities to disrupt worship. Some [defaced churches](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251185/tabernacle-stolen-catholic-church-defaced-pregnancy-clinic-vandalized) with threatening graffiti, while others disrupted Mass by screaming and [chanting pro-abortion slogans](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251531/nearly-naked-protester-disrupts-mass-in-michigan). Just weeks before Roeâ€™s overturn, an armed California man [was arrested](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251490/armed-man-arrested-supreme-court-justice-brett-kavanaugh-home) near the residence of Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh for threatening to kill him. Kavanaugh sided with the majority in the Dobbs decision. Pregnancy resource centers and other pro-life institutions [came under attack](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251174/threats-to-catholic-masses-mothers-day) as well. Some organizations were burned in arson attacks. Others were left threats written in graffiti. Many clinics had their windows smashed. The attacks only got worse once Roe was officially overturned in June, and they continued throughout 2023, with the latest reported act of vandalism occurring this fall at a group of Catholic churches. The Attacks In January, St. Stephen Catholic Church in Riverview, Florida, had a pro-life sign on its grounds vandalized, according to [The Patch](https://patch.com/florida/bloomingdale/fl-church-responds-prayer-abortion-issue-divides-communities). The sign, which said â€œAbortion stops a beating heart,â€ was graffitied with the words â€œSave the pro-choice mom.â€ That same month, two hooded individuals were caught on camera vandalizing a pro-life pregnancy center in Houston. The leader of the clinic [told CNA](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/253552/leader-of-houston-pro-life-pregnancy-center-says-pro-abortion-vandalism-was-racist) that the vandals wrote â€œAbortion for allâ€ on the front of the clinic and glued the locks on the entrance of the facility. In March, vandals smashed the windows of First Care pregnancy center in Minneapolis and spray-painted it with graffiti, saying: â€œIf abortions arnâ€™t safe neither r uâ€ and â€œJane was here.â€ â€œ [Janeâ€™s Revenge](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251518/what-is-janes-revenge-pro-abortion-vandalism),â€ or iterations of it, such as â€œJane was here,â€ became a calling card of sorts for dozens of pro-abortion vandals after the May 2022 leak from the Supreme Court. One clinic in New York that was spray-painted with â€œJaneâ€™s Revengeâ€ graffiti in 2022 in an [arson attack](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251477/police-investigation-fire-graffiti-at-upstate-new-york-pro-life-pregnancy-center) was [vandalized](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/253893/ny-pregnancy-center-that-was-set-on-fire-is-hit-again-with-jane-s-revenge-rhetoric) again this past March. The word â€œliarsâ€ was spray-painted in red capital letters across CompassCareâ€™s sign at its 1230 Eggert Road, Amherst, location. The same month police arrested 39-year-old Hannah Kamke in connection with the crime and charged her with one count of criminal mischief in the third degree, which is a Class E felony and holds a [maximum penalty](https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/laws/PEN/70.00) of up to four yearsâ€™ imprisonment. Kamke entered a plea agreement and avoided jail time, agreeing to pay $2,580 in restitution, according to [Buffalo News](https://buffalonews.com/news/compasscare-hannah-kamke-vandalization-abortion-clinic/article_e5013582-53f0-11ee-b2f9-ab736913de2d.html). The vandals who set that clinic on fire last year and caused hundreds of thousands of dollars in damages still have not been identified by police or the FBI, despite the bureauâ€™s offer of a $25,000 reward for information leading to an arrest. The following month, in April, the words â€œLiars,â€ â€œFake clinic,â€ â€œJaneâ€™s Revenge,â€ â€œFund abortion,â€ and â€œAbort God,â€ were scrawled across Bowling Green Pregnancy Center, also known as HerChoice, in Bowling Green, Ohio. Federal charges were filed against a 20-year-old college student in Ohio, Whitney Durant, who goes by the name Soren Monroe, for allegedly vandalizing the clinic. Durant pled guilty this month in federal court to a misdemeanor under the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances (FACE) Act and faces a maximum of one year in prison. Her sentencing is set for April 9, 2024. The FACE Act [prohibits](https://www.justice.gov/crt/protecting-patients-and-health-care-providers) â€œviolent, threatening, damaging, and obstructive conduct intended to injure, intimidate, or interfere with the right to seek, obtain, or provide reproductive health services.â€ Durantâ€™s prosecution under the FACE Act is a milestone for the Department of Justice, which has [disproportionately targeted pro-life activists](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/255433/republicans-urge-repeal-of-weaponized-face-act-due-to-anti-pro-life-bias) under the statute. Kristen Clarke, assistant attorney general of the DOJâ€™s Civil Rights Division, said that â€œdefacing facilities that provide reproductive health services will not be tolerated in our societyâ€ after Durantâ€™s guilty plea. In the past five months alone, the DOJ [convicted](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/256036/elderly-pro-life-activist-with-significant-medical-issues-convicted-on-face-act-charge) nine pro-life activists under FACE Act charges related to the Oct. 22, 2020, sit-in in which they blocked access to the clinicâ€™s abortion services, according to prosecutors. During the blockade of the clinic, which was livestreamed on Facebook, some of those who sat inside the clinic can be seen praying the rosary and singing hymns to the Blessed Virgin Mary while refusing to leave. The most recent of the nine to be convicted is [Paulette Harlow](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/256036/elderly-pro-life-activist-with-significant-medical-issues-convicted-on-face-act-charge) of Kingston, Massachusetts, 75, who has severe health issues and could face up to 11 years in prison. In May, a Catholic-based clinic, JMJ Pregnancy Center in Orlando, Florida, had three mutilated animals left on its property consisting of a chicken, a large bird, and baby lamb. The director of the clinic [told CNA](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/254329/mutilated-animals-left-on-pro-life-pregnancy-centers-property-in-orlando) at the time that he thought â€œthere was probably some kind of ritual that was involved.â€ In July, a pregnancy center in Las Vegas was attacked with graffiti that said â€œFraud,â€ among other words, according to [8 News Now](https://www.8newsnow.com/news/local-news/vandals-target-las-vegas-pregnancy-center/). The â€œaâ€ in fraud was drawn in the shape of an anarchist symbol. In October, there were a series of pro-abortion attacks at Catholic churches in Ohio ahead of the stateâ€™s November referendum to enshrine abortion rights into law. That referendum ultimately passed. Churches in Centerville, Cincinnati, Clifton, and Oxford [had signs targeted](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/255889/pro-abortion-vandals-target-ohio-catholic-churches-schools-before-issue-1-vote) that were encouraging Ohioans to vote no on the referendum. Incarnation Catholic Church in Centerville was targeted with graffiti in addition to its signs being vandalized. CNA has [counted](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/251553/map-vandalism-attacks-continue-at-pro-life-centers-across-us) more than 60 pro-life pregnancy centers and almost 40 Catholic churches that have been targeted since the overturning of Roe v. Wade. In January, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a [resolution](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-resolution/1233/text) condemning recent attacks on pro-life facilities, groups, and churches. The resolution also called on the Biden administration to use law enforcement to keep the institutions safe. - Keywords: [pro-life pregnancy centers](https://www.ncregister.com/tag/pro-life-pregnancy-centers)
